docs.snippet: The event of the present week will be Mr. GRAU'S season at the Academy of Music, commencing to-morrow evening and terminating with the sixth subsequent performance. In Brooklyn the opera will commence on Thursday and continue on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The event of the present week will be Mr. GRAU'S season at the Academy of Music, commencing to-morrow evening and terminating with the sixth subsequent performance. In Brooklyn the opera will commence on Thursday and continue on...

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: CIVIL WAR (THE WAR BETWEEN THE STATES)

headline.main: The End of the Trent Affair England Satisfied.

docs.snippet: Gov. DAWSON has left us for the East, and Judge CROSBY and Ex-Superintendent MARTIN, it is said, will soon follow, so that we shall be left without Governor, Marshal or Judge.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN UTAH; The New Governor and His Departure A Convention in Prospect.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. DAWSON has left us for the East, and Judge CROSBY and Ex-Superintendent MARTIN, it is said, will soon follow, so that we shall be left without Governor, Marshal or Judge.

docs.snippet: The enemy, under the immediate command of Maj.-Gen. CRITTENDEN, marched, eight regiments strong, from their camp, last Saturday night. Their mounted grand guards were skirmishing through the greater part of the night with ours. Col. WOLFORD'S...

headline.main: Details of the Battle of Mill Creek.; FULL ACCOUNT OF THE ACTION. Desperate Fighting on Both Sides. DEATH OF ZOLLICOFFER. Total Rout and Demoralization of the Enemy. Gen. Crittenden Probably Hiding in the Woods.

docs.snippet: TIMES of yesterday, we gave place to the complaint of "A Parent," in regard to the merciless lessons assigned to pupils in one of our primary schools.

docs.lead_paragraph: TIMES of yesterday, we gave place to the complaint of "A Parent," in regard to the merciless lessons assigned to pupils in one of our primary schools.

docs.snippet: Bishop McILVAINE, of Ohio, who is at present traveling in England, writes a letter to Bishop BEDELL,  which is published in the Gambler Episcopalian. The following are the material parts:

headline.main: Feeling in England.; VIEWS OF BISHOP M'ILVAINE, OF OHIO.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bishop McILVAINE, of Ohio, who is at present traveling in England, writes a letter to Bishop BEDELL, which is published in the Gambler Episcopalian. The following are the material parts:

docs.snippet: Petitions for the erection of fortifications along the frontier, and in favor of the Metropolitan Health Bill, were received.

headline.main: PROCEEDINGS OF THE LEGISLATURE.; SENATE. ASSEMBLY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Petitions for the erection of fortifications along the frontier, and in favor of the Metropolitan Health Bill, were received.
